item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

Why am i having a problem with this??
[scar]M1[0]:= 35;
M1[1]:= 37;
M1[2]:= 39;
M1[3]:= 40;
M1[4]:= 38;

M2[0]:= 10;
M2[1]:= 8;
M2[2]:= 9;
M2[3]:= 15;
M2[4]:= 5;

M3[0]:= 690;
M3[1]:= 692;
M3[2]:= 687;

M4[0]:= 74;
M4[1]:= 84;
M4[2]:= 79;

M5[0]:= 691;
M5[1]:= 692;

M6[0]:= 61;
M6[1]:= 56;
[/scar]

My arrays are for my mouse procedures but this is not where i get my problems.
Here are my problems below…

[scar]
Mouse(M3[random(2)],M4[random(2)],3,3,true)//just a clicking procedure

Getmousepos(x,y)//for a symbol procedure
Mouse(x+ M1[random(4)],y+ M2[random(4)] ,2,2,True)

Mouse(M5[random(1)],M6[random(1)],3,3,True)//and another clicking procedure
[/scar]

And yes the script does compile,
But those mouse procedures never click anywhere close to where I want them too.
Am I doing something wrong?
Help please.
~jR

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Try this:
[scar]begin
case random(2) of
0:case random(2) of
0:begin end;
1:begin end;
end;
1:case random(2) of
0:begin end;
1:begin end;
end;
end;
end;[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

So wait… It isnt possible to put a case random inside a case random?
Or should I just do the second thing I suggested?

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Yes it’s possible, but you need another end; on that.

[scar]Begin
Case Random(2) Of
1:Begin
{* couple of procedures*}
//Procedure name that contains a case random
//Another procedure name that contains a case random.
End;
2:Begin
{* couple of procedures*}
//Procedure name that contains a case random
//Another procedure name that contains a case random.
End;
End;
End;[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

Ok I got another question for you.
Is it possible to add a case random procedure inside another case random procedure??
Ex:
[scar]
Begin
Case Random(2) Of
1:Begin
{* couple of procedures*}
case random(2) of
1:{* more procedures*}
2:{* more procedures*}
End;
2:Begin
{* couple of procedures*}
Case Random(2) Of
1:{* more procedures*}
2:{* more procedures*}
End;
and so on…[/scar]

I always keep getting weird error like " : expected" and " Syntax error" and there isn’t a syntax and I don’t need a ‘:’ anywhere.
And if this isn’t possible is there another way I can do something like this?
Because I was thinking about doing something like
[scar]
Begin
Case Random(2) Of
1:Begin
{* couple of procedures*}
//Procedure name that contains a case random
//Another procedure name that contains a case random.
End;
2:Begin
{* couple of procedures*}
//Procedure name that contains a case random
//Another procedure name that contains a case random.
End;
End;
[/scar]
Help please.

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I’m guessing color is the symbol color that you want the user to either manually pick and enter it as a const, and if they don’t want to pick it, it automatically finds the color and replaces the const with it. If thats the case, you won’t be able to change the const, so it wouldn’t work, but, you could do a little ConstToVar converter at the beginning of the script, like this:

[SCAR]const
//The user defines the symbol color here:
TreeSymbolColor = 0;

var
//The variable that the TreeColor const will be put in is defined here:
TheTreeSymbolColor: Integer;

//----------------------//

procedure ConstToVar;
begin
TheTreeSymbolColor := TreeSymbolColor;
end;

//And then you could add the color picking procedure like this:

procedure GetTreeSymbolColor;
begin
if TheTreeSymbolColor = 0 then
begin
if (FindSymbol(x, y, ‘rare tree’)) then
begin
TheTreeSymbolColor := GetColor(x, y);
end;
end;
end;[/scar]

I hope that was what you were looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

[scar]if color=0 then
Begin
if(findsymbol(mx,my,’–’))then
color:= getcolor(ax,ay)[/scar]

There’s already an integer named ‘my’ somewhere. So change your variables to ax and ay, or something like that instead.

EDIT2:I was wondering. When I made my color finding procedure, I want to know how to use it as a const and a var together. Or do you have to use 2 different variables and name them differently. Like if they leave the number 0 in the const , to begin my search, and if the color is greater then 0, to not start the search.

Im confused

    [br][size=1]Posted at: October 30, 2006, 06:20:33 PM[/size][hr]Check out my 2nd edit.[br][size=1]Posted at: October 31, 2006, 06:20:01 PM[/size][hr]No one at all could help me out on this?

I just tried to set up the colors again but I either get a duplicate identifier error, or a variable expected error.
If you still dont know what im trying to do is somthing like this
[scar]if color=0 then
Begin
if(findsymbol(mx,my,’–’)then
color:= getcolor(mx,my)[/scar]
but i keep getting the same 2 errors.
If I set them up as both a var and a const I get dup identifier error.
And if I just set it up as a const I get a var needed error.
~jR
And sorry for the douple or more posting, im just getting fustrated with this.

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Well, first off, after your if statement checking to see if you have died, you need a begin:

if(wearedead)then begin writeln('We Have died..') writeln('Logging out and terminating script') Logout; ProgressReport; TerminateScript; end;

When using If statements, if you don’t put a begin after it, it will only execute the first line afterwards, but if you add a begin, then it will execute everything between the begin and end;. What you had before would’ve wrote the line ‘We Have died’ only if wearedead returned true, and then no matter what, it would’ve wrote the line 'Logging out and terminating script, and then terminated the script.

As for the continuous chopping, I think it may have something to do with your chop procedure, I’m guessing the script is getting stuck in a loop there. If you want you can pm me that procedure and I’ll take a look at it.

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

I looked at almost everyones script, but whatever i do i cant get my main loop to work…
This is what i got so far.
[scar]Repeat
repeat
chop;
until(invfull=true)
walktobank;
bank;
walking;
if(wearedead)then
writeln(‘We Have died…’)
writeln(‘Logging out and terminating script’)
Logout;
ProgressReport;
Terminatescript;
Until(chopamount>=(amounttochop))[/scar]
will that work??
Because all it does for me is continue chopping and wont stop. I dont want to post my whole script but I do have more stuff on the top and bottom, if you want to help me out and need to see the whole script please PM(but this is only if i know you have good SCAR knowledge, and if i trust you :P)
~jR
